descriptions.presentation_cameroun: Discover the strategic, economic, and natural opportunities of Cameroon that attract investors from around the world.
descriptions.cadre_juridique: Access essential information on tax and legal frameworks that ensure a safe and competitive investment environment in Cameroon.
descriptions.sanctuaires: Strategic infrastructures and hubs for industrial development.
descriptions.socles: Fundamental bases for solid industrial development.
descriptions.creation_entreprise: Practical guide to starting a business in Cameroon.
descriptions.droit_investisseurs: Presentation of legal protections and rights guaranteed to foreign investors.
descriptions.facteurs_production: Information on required resources: capital, raw materials, and equipment.
descriptions.incitation: Incentive measures and tax advantages to encourage investment.
descriptions.presentation_api: Discover the role of the API in supporting investment projects.
descriptions.faq: Find quick and clear answers to your frequently asked questions about investment.
descriptions.conseil_en_ligne: Access personalized assistance and get quick answers to all your investment opportunities questions.

hero.titre: Investing in the Future of Agro-industry
hero.sous_titre: Join us to revolutionize the agro-industrial sanctuary with sustainable technologies and innovative agricultural solutions.

objectif.texte: Supply domestic, CEEAC and Nigerian markets with 2nd and 3rd transformation food products through enhanced valorization of local raw materials and export promotion.

actions.desc_technologique: Development and optimization of structuring agricultural technologies.
actions.desc_industrielle: Strengthening and integration of agricultural branches with other sectors.

speculations.sous_titre: A diversity of agricultural products to meet market needs

potentiel.description: Cameroon, often referred to as the "breadbasket of Central Africa", has immense agro-industrial potential thanks to its varied climate, fertile lands and crop diversity. This sector is an essential pillar for food security and economic growth.
potentiel.texte_diversite: Production of cocoa, coffee, bananas, palm oil, cotton, corn, cassava, etc.
potentiel.texte_transformation: Opportunities to transform agricultural products into value-added products (juices, preserves, oils, etc.)
potentiel.texte_exportation: Potential to export agro-industrial products to regional and international markets
potentiel.texte_emplois: Development of value chains to generate direct and indirect jobs
potentiel.texte_infrastructures: Insufficient storage, processing and transportation infrastructure
potentiel.texte_financement: Difficulties for small producers and SMEs to obtain credit
potentiel.texte_importations: Import of processed products despite the availability of local raw materials
potentiel.texte_climat: Impact on agricultural yields and productivity

hero.sous_titre: Cameroon, rich in energy resources, offers unique opportunities for investors in the renewable energy, infrastructure, and technological innovation sectors.

objectif.texte: Streamline the use of biomass, optimize energy production and consumption, and generate export surpluses to the CEEAC and Nigeria.

reseau_gazoducs.description: Construction of gas pipelines connecting Limbé, Kribi, Douala, Ebolowa, Yaoundé, Bafoussam, and Bamenda to facilitate the transition to natural gas vehicles (NGV).

centrales_secours.description: Installation of backup power stations in Douala (300 MW), Yaoundé (300 MW), Bafoussam (100 MW), Bamenda (100 MW), Ebolowa (40 MW), and Limbé (40 MW).

voies_ferroviaires.description: Construction of 1,850 km of railways for the collection and export of biomass energy.

exportation_energie.description: Supply of 50 TWh of electricity to Nigeria and CEMAC states.

solaire.description: Harnessing solar energy for sustainable and environmentally friendly production.

eolienne.description: Development of wind farms for clean and renewable energy production.

hydraulique.description: Utilizing hydraulic resources for stable and reliable energy production.

fossile.description: Gradual transition to sustainable alternatives while optimizing the use of existing resources.

potentiel.texte: Cameroon has considerable energy potential, with abundant hydroelectric, solar, and wind resources. The energy sector is a key pillar for the economic and social development of the country.

opportunites.hydroelectriques: Hydroelectric resources: Estimated potential of over 23 GW, mainly on the Sanaga River.
opportunites.energies_renouvelables: Renewable energies: Strong solar and wind potential, still underutilized.
opportunites.projets_structurants: Structuring projects: Nachtigal Dam (420 MW) and other plants under development.
opportunites.exportation_energie: Energy export: Potential to export electricity to neighboring CEMAC countries.

defis.electrification: Low electrification rate: Only 65% of the population has access to electricity, with disparities between urban and rural areas.
defis.infrastructures: Aging infrastructure: Obsolete distribution networks and high technical losses.
defis.energies_fossiles: Dependence on fossil fuels: Use of expensive and polluting thermal plants.
defis.financement: Insufficient funding: Need for massive investments to develop energy infrastructure.

hero.sous_titre: Transforming Cameroon into a regional digital hub through modern infrastructure, enhanced governance, and strategic investments.

objectif.texte: Position Cameroon among the Top 5 most advanced African countries in the digital revolution while ensuring enhanced national sovereignty and security.

details.desc_commandement: Collaboration between PRC, MINDEF, MINPOSTEL, MINEPAT, MINCOM, MINMIDT, ANTIC for a secure digital ecosystem.
details.desc_perimetre: Identification and protection of sensitive state points.

details.desc_restructuration: Make CAMTEL the leader of the Cameroonian market in 3 years and a major player in the CEEAC region and Nigeria.

details.desc_fonderie: 2,000 million FCFA to support innovative projects and digital startups.

details.desc_marche: Partnership with a reference operator for an investment of 50 million USD and a target market share of 40%.

domaines.texte: Discover the strategic areas that make Cameroon a regional digital hub.

cybersecurite.description: Protection of critical infrastructure and sensitive data against digital threats.

infrastructures.description: Development and modernization of communication networks and digital platforms.

innovation.description: Support for digital entrepreneurs and innovative technology projects.

formation.description: Development of digital skills through education, training, and reskilling.

potentiel.texte: Cameroon is experiencing rapid growth in the digital sector, driven by a dynamic young population and increasing adoption of mobile and internet technologies. Digital is a key driver for the country’s economic and social transformation.

opportunites.penetration_mobile: Mobile and internet penetration: Rapid growth of smartphone and internet users.
opportunites.services_financiers: Digital financial services: Expansion of mobile money and online payment solutions.
opportunites.e_gouvernement: E-government: Modernization of public services through digital technologies.
opportunites.entrepreneuriat: Digital entrepreneurship: Emergence of innovative startups in fintech, agritech, and edtech.

defis.infrastructures: Insufficient infrastructure: Limited network coverage, especially in rural areas.
defis.couts: High service costs: Internet and smartphones remain expensive for a large part of the population.
defis.competences: Lack of technical skills: Need for training and capacity building in digital professions.
defis.reglementation: Outdated regulatory framework: Need to adapt laws to foster innovation and protect users.

hero.sous_titre: The financial foundation is a set of reforms aimed at strengthening Cameroon's financial system to support the country's industrialization.

objectif.texte: Implement essential reforms to transform Cameroon into a leading financial hub in the Gulf of Guinea and support the country's industrialization vision.

details.transformation: Transformation of SNI into a sovereign fund
details.mutation: Conversion of BC-PME into an investment bank
details.reforme: Reform of CARPA into a PPP agency

potentiel.description: The financing sector in Cameroon plays a crucial role in economic development. It supports investments, entrepreneurship, and the growth of key sectors but faces significant challenges in meeting the country's needs.

opportunites.croissance: Banking sector growth: Expansion of local and international financial institutions.
opportunites.financement: SME financing: Support programs for small and medium-sized enterprises.
opportunites.partenariats: Public-private partnerships (PPP): Opportunities to finance major infrastructure projects.
opportunites.innovation: Financial innovation: Development of digital solutions (mobile money, fintech) to improve access to financing.

defis.acces: Limited access to credit: High interest rates and required guarantees for loans.
defis.manque: Lack of diversification: Limited supply of financial products tailored to the needs of SMEs and individuals.
defis.inclusion: Low financial inclusion: A large part of the population lacks access to banking services.
defis.risque: Investment-related risks: Lack of investor confidence due to economic and regulatory instability.

hero.description: The infrastructure foundation is a key sector for Cameroon's economic development. It encompasses the basic infrastructures necessary for the proper functioning of the economy and the improvement of living conditions for the population.

objectif.texte: Build a solid foundation of physical, cognitive, and institutional infrastructures to promote territorial connectivity and establish a human capital base capable of supporting industrialization.

potentiel.description: The infrastructure sector in Cameroon is an essential pillar to support economic growth and improve quality of life. However, major challenges persist in modernizing and expanding infrastructures in the country.

opportunites.projets: Structuring projects: Construction of roads, bridges, ports, and airports to open up regions.
opportunites.energie: Energy and telecommunications: Development of energy and digital infrastructures to support growth.
opportunites.partenariats: Public-private partnerships (PPP): Collaboration to finance and implement infrastructure projects.
opportunites.integration: Regional integration: Cross-border infrastructures to strengthen trade in Central Africa.

defis.manque: Lack of funding: Need for massive investments to develop infrastructures.
defis.retards: Project delays: Management and implementation issues of infrastructure projects.
defis.maintenance: Insufficient maintenance: Deterioration of existing infrastructures due to lack of upkeep.
defis.desequilibre: Regional imbalance: Concentration of infrastructures in urban areas to the detriment of rural areas.

hero.description: The wood-forest sector is a key area of the Cameroonian economy, offering numerous investment and development opportunities.

objectif.texte: Make Cameroon's forest massif the launch pad for the railway plan, energy exports, and the development of a highly integrated sector with other industrial sectors.

institutions.creation: Creation of the National Wood Office (ONB)
institutions.societe_depot: Cameroonian Company for the Storage of Forest Products (SCDPF)
institutions.caisse: Stabilization Fund for Forest Product Prices (CSPPF)

zones.architecture: Architecture of the EDEA and BENGBIS CIIs

commercialisation.interdiction: Ban on transporting logs outside ZTI

formation.ecole: School of Wood Arts and Crafts

potentiel.description: Cameroon has the second-largest forest massif in Africa, with rich biodiversity and abundant forest resources. The wood and forest sector offers major opportunities for the national economy, while requiring sustainable management to preserve the environment.

opportunites.exploitation: Sustainable exploitation: Responsible forest management to preserve biodiversity while generating income.
opportunites.transformation: Local transformation: Development of wood processing industries (furniture, parquet, etc.) to add value.
opportunites.exportation: Export: International market for Cameroonian wood, notably to Europe and Asia.
opportunites.ecotourisme: Ecotourism: Valorization of forests to attract tourists and generate additional income.

defis.exploitation: Illegal exploitation: Illegal logging and unregulated wood trade.
defis.deforestation: Deforestation: Loss of forest cover due to agriculture and urbanization.
defis.manque: Lack of local transformation: Export of raw wood without added value.
defis.concurrence: International competition: Difficulty competing with imported processed products.

hero.description: The textile, garment, and leather sector is a key part of Cameroon's economy. It is one of the country's main employers and contributes significantly to economic growth.

objectif.texte: Ensure industrialization through the transformation and enhancement of local raw materials and the promotion of exports.

renforcement_industriel.nouvelles_filatures: Support for the installation of new spinning units (300,000 t/year)
renforcement_industriel.transformation_coton: Processing of 50% of cotton production (600,000 tons)

innovation_formation.centre_technique: Establishment of a Textile Technical Center
innovation_formation.encadrement_coton: Supervision of cotton cultivation (high-performance varieties, irrigation, financing)
innovation_formation.formation_cuir: Training and technical strengthening for the leather industry

securisation_regulation.reduction_contrebande: 20% annual reduction in smuggling, fraud, and counterfeiting
securisation_regulation.commande_publique: Establishment of public procurement (50% for army uniforms)
securisation_regulation.clauses_sauvegarde: Safeguard clauses for the emergence of local footwear

industrie_cuir.centre_tri: Creation of a national leather sorting center
industrie_cuir.nouvelles_unites: New industrial units for leather product manufacturing

champions_regionaux.creation_champions: Creation of regional champions in textiles
champions_regionaux.recherche_cuir: Strengthening research from raw to finished leather

potentiel.description: The textile, garment, and leather sector in Cameroon has significant potential, thanks to abundant local raw materials and a growing demand for finished products. This sector can contribute to job creation and economic diversification.

opportunites.matieres_premieres: Local raw materials: Availability of cotton, leather, and other materials for production.
opportunites.marche: Local and regional market: Growing demand for clothing, shoes, and accessories.
opportunites.mode_africaine: African fashion: Opportunities in promoting local culture and designs.
opportunites.exportation: Export: Potential to export finished products to international markets.

defis.infrastructures: Lack of modern infrastructure: Obsolete production units and lack of equipment.
defis.concurrence: Import competition: Influx of low-cost textile and leather products from Asia.
defis.formation: Insufficient training: Lack of qualified labor in garment and leather trades.
defis.financement: Access to financing: Difficulties for small businesses to obtain credit for investment.

hero.description: The hydrocarbons, petrochemicals, and refining sector is a strategic sector for Cameroon. It offers numerous investment projects and business opportunities.

objectif.texte: Undertake a profound transformation in the upstream and downstream oil sector, and capitalize on potential through diversified activities to support the country's integrated industrialization.

valorisation_ressources.petrole_gaz: Development of oil and gas potential
valorisation_ressources.mineraux: Promotion of the exploitation of mineral reserves (Iron, Bauxite, Nickel-Cobalt, etc.)

infrastructures_energetiques.usine_engrais: Construction of a fertilizer plant in Njonji

gaz_naturel_gpl.distribution_douala: Extension of gas distribution in Douala
gaz_naturel_gpl.promotion_carburant: Promotion of natural gas as fuel

centrales_energie.extension_kribi: Extension of Kribi thermal power plant
centrales_energie.fourniture_gaz: Gas supply to the Kribi plant

potentiel.description: Cameroon has significant potential in the hydrocarbons and refining sector, with oil and natural gas reserves, as well as refining infrastructure. This sector is a major pillar of the national economy.

opportunites.reserves: Oil and gas reserves: Active oil and gas basins, especially in Rio del Rey and Logone Birni.
opportunites.raffinage_local: Local refining: The National Refining Company (SONARA) allows the conversion of crude oil into finished products.
opportunites.exportation_gaz: Natural gas export: Potential to develop liquefied natural gas (LNG) for export.
opportunites.emplois: Job creation: The sector generates direct and indirect jobs, especially in oil zones.

defis.prix_mondiaux: Global price dependency: Vulnerability to international oil price fluctuations.
defis.infrastructures_vieillissantes: Aging infrastructure: Need to modernize refining and distribution facilities.
defis.environnement: Environmental impact: Waste management and pollution risks related to oil exploitation.
defis.importations: Import dependency: Despite local refining, the country still imports petroleum products to meet demand.

hero.description: The Chemistry & Pharmacy pillar aims to transform natural resources into high value-added products, while promoting innovation and research in the fields of chemistry and pharmacy. This strategic sector is essential for the country's economic and industrial development.

objectif.texte: Develop and promote a network of highly integrated chemical sector industries into the national economy.

competitivite_innovation.groupements_filieres: Purchasing groups and integrated value chains (agrochemistry)

industrie_pharmaceutique.medicaments_generiques: Priority on generic and essential medicines
industrie_pharmaceutique.industrie_locale: Emergence of a local pharmaceutical industry

potentiel.description: The Chemistry and Pharmacy sector in Cameroon has significant potential, with a growing demand for pharmaceutical and chemical products. This sector is essential to meet healthcare needs and support industrial development.

opportunites.marche_croissance: Growing local market: Increased demand for medicines and chemical products.
opportunites.production_generiques: Generic medicine production: Opportunities to reduce costs and improve access to healthcare.
opportunites.ressources_naturelles: Natural resources: Availability of raw materials for the production of chemical and pharmaceutical products.
opportunites.exportation_regionale: Regional exports: Potential to export pharmaceutical products to neighboring countries.

defis.importations: Dependence on imports: High reliance on imported pharmaceutical and chemical products.
defis.recherche_developpement: Lack of R&D: Low investment in innovation and local production.
defis.normes_qualite: Quality standards: Need to strengthen regulations to ensure product quality.
defis.acces_financement: Access to funding: Difficulty for local companies to obtain credit for investment.

hero.description: The mining, metallurgy, and steel sector plays a crucial role in economic development. It offers investment and growth opportunities through the exploitation of natural resources and the transformation of raw materials.

objectif.texte: Capitalize on the dynamism of national operators in the sector to unlock the rich potential of mineral resources and initiate major mining projects in the medium term.

exploitation_valorisation.valorisation_or_diamant: Industrial valorization of Gold and Diamond
exploitation_valorisation.laboratoire_national: National laboratory for mineral substance analysis

formation_expertise.moyens_techniques: Improvement of technical resources of institutions

potentiel.description: Cameroon has significant mining and industrial potential, with a variety of mineral resources and opportunities in metal processing. This sector is essential for diversifying the economy and creating jobs.

opportunites.ressources_abondantes: Abundant mineral resources: Bauxite, iron, cobalt, nickel, gold, diamonds, etc.
opportunites.projets_structurants: Structural projects: Mbalam-Nabeba iron project and other initiatives to exploit deposits.
opportunites.transformation_locale: Local processing: Opportunities to develop mineral processing industries.
opportunites.exportation: Export: Potential to export minerals and metallurgical products to international markets.

defis.manque_infrastructures: Lack of infrastructure: Insufficient facilities for mining and processing.
defis.cadre_legal: Legal and fiscal framework: Need to improve the regulatory environment to attract investment.
defis.impact_environnemental: Environmental impact: Waste management and pollution risks linked to mining.
defis.concurrence_internationale: International competition: Difficulty competing with major global producers.
